title: Gang associates 'mistake innocent young man for rival in fatal shooting'
text:

An innocent young man was shot dead after "gang members" mistook him for their rival, a court heard.

Hamza Ul Haq, 21, Loic Nengese, 19, and a 16-year-old boy allegedly murdered Joseph William-Torres, 20, in the belief he was Samuel Hunter.

Mr Torres was blasted at point-blank range in the chest on March 14, 2018.

Jurors at the Old Bailey heard the man was ambushed by three men associated with an east London gang known as the of the Mali crew.

The attack, which "lasted 100 seconds" in Walthamstow, northeast London, killed Mr Torres.

It is said the three men were intent on a revenge attack after Ul Haq had been squirted with acid and his friend was stabbed by masked youths in a Subway shop some months previously.

(Image: central news)

"They had, it would appear, mistakenly identified him for another: Samuel Hunter.

"Samuel Hunter is a male of the same height, same build, similar facial features, who even possessed and wore the same beanie hat as Joseph William Torres, who lived locally and often socialised in Essex Close with and where members of Priory Court used to meet," Alison Hunter, QC, prosecuting, said.

Ul Haq, of Manor Park, east London, Nengese of Walthamstow, and the youth from Upper Clapton, all deny murder.

But the court heard the attack was "planned".

Ms Hunter continued: "It was undoubtedly a ruthless and planned attack on a rival group member, but he was not the intended target.

"The explanation perhaps lies in the fact that this shooting was not an isolated incident - rather it took place in the context of what can be characterised as a series of related and retaliatory acts of violence that had at its roots, a dispute between rival groups of youths.

(Image: PA)

"Hamza Ul Haq, Loic Nengese, and [the youth] are three young men who are not only friends and associates of each other, but who are also associates of a larger group known as the Mali Boys.

"The Mali Boys are a territorial antisocial grouping of young people who are known to collect on the streets and gather in and around Subway in St James Street and frequent the Arabian Nights Shisha Bar in Walthamstow High Street. They had become increasingly confrontational and angry with everyone since the murder of one of their own, Elijah Dornelly in May 2017; they were engaged in a turf war with a number of other local groups of youths, in particular over the relevant period they were in conflict with another grouping known as Priory Court.

"It can be inferred from where they went to avenge this attack, that Ul-Haq and his Mali Boy associates presumed that this was an attack upon them by Priory Court. This clearly provided additional fuel to their anger and lent a particularly personal quality to the revenge motive for their actions on 14 March 2018."

The trial continues.
description: It's alleged Hamza Ul Haq, 21, Loic Nengese, 19, and a 16-year-old boy murdered Joseph William-Torres in the belief he was their nemesis Samuel Hunter
